comments: This introductory course examines how cultures are created, maintained, and most importantly, how they affect behavior. The course deconstructs the world of social interactions and behaviors and examines how theory and research relate to social behavior.  Students found the material introduced in this class to be very interesting. Some students reported that there was a lot of reading assigned for this course.   Most students wrote that they learned a lot from Professor Lareau. Some students felt that she was quite good at stimulating their interest in the subject but others felt that she spent too much time reading from her slides rather than actively engaging the students.   Many students in this class were freshman and non-majors fulfilling a requirement. There are no prerequisites listed for this course. This class may be taken to fulfill the Society Sector requirement.
